details.title: Unsupervised classification based on non-negative eigenvalue decomposition and Wishart classifier

kwd: polarimetric synthetic aperture radar image analysis
German Aerospace Center E-SAR polarimetric data

authors.affiliation: China Center for Resources Satellite Data & Applic., Beijing, China
authors.name: Youchun Lu

details.abstract: In this study, the authors propose an unsupervised terrain and land-use classification algorithm for polarimetric synthetic aperture radar (SAR) image analysis. Under the non-reflection symmetry condition, the non-negative eigenvalue decomposition (NNED) employing Arii volume scattering model is derived. They first apply NNED to divide pixels into three categories of surface, volume and double bounce scatterings. Then the pixels in each category are further divided into several classes based on the scattering characteristic parameter of the dominant scattering component. Utilising the initial classification result as training sets, the complex Wishart classifier can then be performed within each category or beyond categories to refine the final classification result. The effectiveness of this algorithm is demonstrated using the German Aerospace Center's E-SAR polarimetric data acquired over the Oberpfaffenhofen area in Germany.
